intro: Ochrosia newelliana, commonly known as the Newell's poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble the leaves of the poinsettia. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often overlooked due to the prominence of its colorful foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ochrosia newelliana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant, seasonal display.
